content.description: Will Bill is wild, starts up a dihedral protected by a bolt, continues up a bulgy arete, and finishes with a reachy move over a small roof. Continuous 5.10 climbing moves with great rests between.
content.protection: Cams up 2" with a few nuts.

content.description: Stable Boy starts up a set of hand jam cracks before reaching a ramp. Skirt left a bit and boulder over a roof and continue up and right on another ramp to the ridge line.
content.protection: Cams to 2" with a few nuts.

content.description:
Like any cutoff route taking it will lead to an easier passage but getting there may be fraught danger. This route is no different.

Boulder up the ramp to a shallow weakness in the headwall. The headwall is the crux (5.10) as there is scant pro albeit a small TCU placement along a vertical flake midway up. If you blow it, good chance that the landing on the ramp below will be hard.  At the top one can reach a bomber crack that takes good pro. Use a long sling as the route now cuts off to the right on very positive holds (5.10). Above lies a very nice layback crack that leads to a short dihedral (5.7). The ramp adjacent to the lieback crack can be slick.

Drop down and around to the right from the other three climbs. Start up an unremarkable ramp to the base of the arete that marks the beginning of Calamity Jane. Climb the arete (30ft) placing pro when available. Midway on the arete is a fixed pin (5.10). After surmounting the arete continue up the ridge to the top of the crag (5.6).
content.protection: Cams to 2" with a few nuts.
